definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)

sentences.english: But there is more to writing a good cover letter.
sentences.chinese: 但是想要写出一封精彩的求职信远没有这么简单。

sentences.english: The former scene by dinosaur was more wonderful than human's.
sentences.chinese: 刚退场的恐龙戏码，就比我们精彩有趣得多了。

sentences.english: Operators want the most exciting scenes of the small feeding of goldfish .
sentences.chinese: 最为精彩的要算小金鱼吃食的场面了。

sentences.english: It's a pity that you have missed such a wonderful concert.
sentences.chinese: 真遗憾，你错过了这么精彩的一场音乐会。

sentences.english: So, we may enjoy wonderful performances from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 那我们就能欣赏到来自世界各地的精彩演出了。

sentences.english: Al gave his best 2 a.m. version of the stump speech.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔发表了他最精彩的一次下午2点的政治演讲。

sentences.english: Thanks for your wonderful lecture, President Chen.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢陈会长的精彩报告。

sentences.english: On a sunny northern coast, there are wonderful activities throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光灿烂的蔚蓝海岸，全年都有精彩活动。

sentences.english: Most of the images are taken with micro techniques and lens to be able to shot these great shots.
sentences.chinese: 大多数技术和镜头都能够拍摄这些精彩画面。

sentences.english: I think it is an excellent introduction to the complexity of this material.
sentences.chinese: 我认为它是对这复杂材料的精彩介绍。

sentences.english: My good friend, Dr. Henry Kissinger, wrote a wonderful foreword, which adds luster to the book.
sentences.chinese: 我的好朋友辛格博士写了精彩的序言，为这本书增色。

sentences.english: All of these wonderful books put great ideas into Jo's head.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些精彩的书籍放到曹某的头部伟大的想法。

sentences.english: The five-day trip was wonderful and it covered nearly 1, 500km.
sentences.chinese: 五天的旅游很精彩，行程将近1，500公里。

sentences.english: The play succeeded thanks to the wonderful performance of all the .
sentences.chinese: 由于演员们的精彩表演，这部戏获得了成功。

sentences.english: I'm in the mood for a good film.
sentences.chinese: 我心情很高兴想去看部精彩的电影。

definition: each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
to screen (a movie)/to stage (a play)/a screening/a staging
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
